alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 10 at 6:00AM AKDT until April 10 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING FOR WHITTIER... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Visibility reduced to near zero at times. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. West wind gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Whittier. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will continue until winds rapidly diminish around mid-morning.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
